definition: to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: Golgi to school, only to pick up trash money.
sentences.chinese: 高爾基爲了上學，只得去撿垃圾換錢。

sentences.english: The memo issued to you last time you changed money.
sentences.chinese: 上次您換錢時簽發給您的那個水單。

sentences.english: Scrap iron can be sold for money.
Where can I exchange on holidays?
sentences.chinese: 假日裏我可以到哪裏換錢？

sentences.english: You want to have more time – stop trading it for dollars.
sentences.chinese: 你想要時間的話，就不要把它犧牲掉來換錢。

sentences.english: "I'm just selling my time for money, " says Li.
sentences.chinese: “我只是在拿自己的時間換錢，”李奇才說。

sentences.english: Yes you can change money at the currency-exchange counter on the ground floor.
sentences.chinese: 是的，你可以在一樓貨幣兌換櫃檯換錢。

sentences.english: Do you know where the foreign exchange kiosk is?
sentences.chinese: 我需要換錢，你知道外幣兌換處在哪？

sentences.english: Is it possible to inter-exchange of money between payment processors?
sentences.chinese: 有可能在付款渠道內部換錢嗎？

sentences.english: I'll go out and pick up more empty cans for exchanging money.
sentences.chinese: 我會出去撿更多的空罐來換錢。

sentences.english: High-level officials have been accused of offering money in exchange for votes in the organization's presidential election.
sentences.chinese: 高級官員被指控在提供本組織的總統選舉票換錢。

sentences.english: You can change money at any bank here in the international airport.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在國際機場內的任何一家銀行換錢。

sentences.english: I find the idea of sex for money morally repugnant.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得男妓以性換錢的想法在道德上是矛盾的。

definition: gift given when visiting sb (esp. a local specialty brought back from one's travels, or a special product of one's own country taken overseas) (Tw)
variant of 櫃檯|柜台[gui4 tai2]
sales counter/front desk/bar/(of markets, medicines etc) OTC (over-the-counter)
domestic flight/internal line (air, train, ferry etc)
